alert.note: Alert for Northern Dona Ana County; Otero Mesa; Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 7:04PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Otero, southern Dona Ana, western Hudspeth and El Paso Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 704 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles northeast of Jornada Range to 13 miles south of Sunland Park. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... West El Paso, East El Paso, Central El Paso, Northeast El Paso, Far East El Paso, Mission Valley, Tornillo, Chaparral, Clint, Horizon City, Fabens, Santa Teresa, Vado, Anthony, Hueco Tanks, Las Cruces, Sunland Park, Afton, Anthony Gap and NMSU Main Campus. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 120 and 164. Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 1 and 60. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Dona Ana County; Otero Mesa; Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin
